member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.AmazonPersonalizeEventsRequest

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event
member.summary: Represents user interaction event information sent using the PutEvents API.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.EventId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventId.
An ID associated with the event. If an event ID is not provided, Amazon Personalize generates a unique ID for the event. An event ID is not used as an input to the model. Amazon Personalize uses the event ID to distinquish unique events. Any subsequent events after the first with the same event ID are not used in model training.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.EventType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventType.
The type of event, such as click or download. This property corresponds to the EVENT_TYPE field of your Interactions schema and depends on the types of events you are tracking.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.EventValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventValue.
The event value that corresponds to the EVENT_VALUE field of the Interactions schema.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.Impression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Impression.
A list of item IDs that represents the sequence of items you have shown the user. For example, ["itemId1", "itemId2", "itemId3"].

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.ItemId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemId.
The item ID key that corresponds to the ITEM_ID field of the Interactions schema.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.Properties
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Properties.
A string map of event-specific data that you might choose to record. For example, if a user rates a movie on your site, other than movie ID (itemId) and rating (eventValue) , you might also send the number of movie ratings made by the user.
Each item in the map consists of a key-value pair. For example,
{"numberOfRatings": "12"}
The keys use camel case names that match the fields in the Interactions schema. In the above example, the numberOfRatings would match the 'NUMBER_OF_RATINGS' field defined in the Interactions schema.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.RecommendationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationId.
The ID of the recommendation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Event.SentAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SentAt.
The timestamp (in Unix time) on the client side when the event occurred.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Item
member.summary: Represents item metadata added to an Items dataset using the PutItems API. For more information see Importing Items Incrementally.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Item.ItemId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemId.
The ID associated with the item.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.Item.Properties
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Properties.
A string map of item-specific metadata. Each element in the map consists of a key-value pair. For example, {"numberOfRatings": "12"}.
The keys use camel case names that match the fields in the schema for the Items dataset. In the previous example, the numberOfRatings matches the 'NUMBER_OF_RATINGS' field defined in the Items schema. For categorical string data, to include multiple categories for a single item, separate each category with a pipe separator (|). For example, \"Horror|Action\".

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutEventsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutEvents operation. Records user interaction event data. For more information see Recording Events.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutEventsRequest.EventList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventList.
A list of event data from the session.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutEventsRequest.SessionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionId.
The session ID associated with the user's visit. Your application generates the sessionId when a user first visits your website or uses your application. Amazon Personalize uses the sessionId to associate events with the user before they log in. For more information, see Recording Events.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutEventsRequest.TrackingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrackingId.
The tracking ID for the event. The ID is generated by a call to the CreateEventTracker API.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutEventsRequest.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The user associated with the event.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutEventsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutEvents operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutItemsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutItems operation. Adds one or more items to an Items dataset. For more information see Importing Items Incrementally.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutItemsRequest.DatasetArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatasetArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Items dataset you are adding the item or items to.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutItemsRequest.Items
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Items.
A list of item data.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutItemsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutItems operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutUsersRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutUsers operation. Adds one or more users to a Users dataset. For more information see Importing Users Incrementally.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutUsersRequest.DatasetArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatasetArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Users dataset you are adding the user or users to.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutUsersRequest.Users
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Users.
A list of user data.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.PutUsersResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutUsers operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.User
member.summary: Represents user metadata added to a Users dataset using the PutUsers API. For more information see Importing Users Incrementally.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.User.Properties
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Properties.
A string map of user-specific metadata. Each element in the map consists of a key-value pair. For example, {"numberOfVideosWatched": "45"}.
The keys use camel case names that match the fields in the schema for the Users dataset. In the previous example, the numberOfVideosWatched matches the 'NUMBER_OF_VIDEOS_WATCHED' field defined in the Users schema. For categorical string data, to include multiple categories for a single user, separate each category with a pipe separator (|). For example, \"Member|Frequent shopper\".

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.Model.User.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The ID associated with the user.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.AmazonPersonalizeEventsClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing PersonalizeEvents
Amazon Personalize can consume real-time user event data, such as stream or click data, and use it for model training either alone or combined with historical data. For more information see Recording Events.

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.AmazonPersonalizeEventsClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPersonalizeEventsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.AmazonPersonalizeEventsClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPersonalizeEventsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.param: The AmazonPersonalizeEventsClient Configuration Object

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeEvents.IAmazonPersonalizeEvents
member.summary:
Interface for accessing PersonalizeEvents
Amazon Personalize can consume real-time user event data, such as stream or click data, and use it for model training either alone or combined with historical data. For more information see Recording Events.
